roleset.name: government charging money, tax, duty
roleset.note: TAX-V NOTES: Member of Vncls bill-54.5. (from tax.01-v)
TAXATION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on tax-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls bill-54.5. (from taxation.01-n)
TARIFF-N NOTES: Based on Bolt data. Comparison to tax.01. Tax is a member of VN class bill-54.5. No FN class. Framed by Katie. (from tariff.01-n)

roles.note: Arg1 doesn't seem to occur. The arguments and their numbering aresuggested by comparison with 'bill' and 'charge'. (from tax.01-v)

example.name: just commodity
example.text: The securities-turnover tax has been long criticized by the West German financial community because it tends to drive securities trading and other banking activities out of Frankfurt into rival financial centers, especially London, where-2 [trading transactions]-1 isn't taxed *trace*-1 *trace*-2.

example.name: just taxpayer
example.text: Congress still is struggling to dismantle the unpopular Catastrophic Care Act of 1988, which-1 *trace*-1 boosted benefits for the elderly and *trace* taxed them to pay for the new coverage.
example.arg: which -> the unpopular Catastrophic Care Act
to pay for the new coverage

example.name: taxpayer and commodity
example.text: Well, notes IRS private ruling 8934014, ``a fundamental principle'' is that [income]-1 must be taxed *trace*-1 to whoever earns it.

example.name: same args, inverted syntax
example.text: Currently, even though the issuer doesn't pay tax, [the debt holder]-1 is taxed *trace*-1 on the accrued interest.
example.arg: even though the issuer doesn't pay tax

example.name: just arg3
example.text: the state taxation department... was continuously revising and improving the policies , laws and regulations on the taxation of cooperation with the outside in exploring and developing petroleum ,
example.arg: of cooperation with the outside in exploring and develping petroleum

example.name: args 0, 2 and 3
example.text: The federal taxation of smokers for children's healthcare is illegal under the constitution because children don't smoke.

example.name: with arg1
example.text: This new regime foresees a minimum taxation of 1% in 2003 and 2004,

example.name: args 0, 3
example.text: The result is a 40% cut in their tariffs on industrial products, ...

roleset.name: resultative construction
roleset.note: TAX-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT part 1. Framed by Claire. (from tax.03-v)

example.name: tax brains out
example.text: I 'm in favor of feeding , clothing , and giving shelter to the poor . I 'm against all the gov't institutions that-2 *T*-2 tax our brains out and who inefficiently attempt to provide some of these things .

roleset.name: government charging money
roleset.note: TAX_AWAY-V NOTES: Frameset created by Jena (from tax.02-v)

example.text: Why-1 *PRO* bother if [the profits]-2 will be taxed *-2 away [*T*]-1 ?
